availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alexander W. Copeland (Christian County, Kentucky, tinner and police judge)

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, tinner and police judge. Tennessee native. Married to Sarah Ann Dunnavan Copeland in Christian County, Kentucky, on June 9, 1842. Father of Alexander Copeland, Mary E. Copeland, Emma Copeland, and Jennette Copeland. Tinner in Christian County in 1850. Tinner in Hopkinsville in 1860. Police judge in Christian County from December 12, 1862, to December 20, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, District 2, p. 420B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, Hopkinsville, p. 680.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Christian County, Hopkinsville, p. 406B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Christian County Marriages, Film #000465562, p. 37.
"Alexander W. Copeland (1818-1872)," Find A Grave, Memorial #88551507, accessed August 12, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88551507.
